active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student explains the MISP event structure (e.g., attributes, objects, tags) using a sample JSON snippet. The partner then teaches back the equivalent STIX structure (e.g., Indicator SDO with Observable SCO). Switch roles and validate mappings using official documentation.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a raw IoC in CSV format (e.g., IP: 192.168.1.1, type: malicious, context: C2 server), translate it to both MISP and STIX formats. Validate using online tools like MISP workbench or STIX validator, then discuss automation needs (e.g., scripts or misp2stix) for threat hunting pipelines.
